name.title: Service name
name.description: The name of the service instance

sleep.description: The sleep duration in seconds before tasks exit.

user.title: User
user.description: The user that the service will run as.

principal.title: Custom principal (optional)
principal.description: The principal for the service instance, or empty to use the default.

secret_name.title: Credential secret name (optional)
secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

virtual_network_name.description: The name of the virtual network to join

virtual_network_plugin_labels.description: Labels to pass to the virtual network plugin. Comma-separated key:value pairs. For example: k_0:v_0,k_1:v_1,...,k_n:v_n

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

mesos_api_version.description: The Mesos API version to be used by the DC/OS service.

cpus.description: MongoDB server node cpu requirements. Example: 1 equals one CPU, 0.1 equals 10% of one CPU, etc

mem.description: MongoDB server node mem requirements, in megabytes

disk.description: MongoDB server node disk requirements, in megabytes

diskType.description: MongoDB server node disk type, see DCOS documentation regarding Disk Resources for more info

count.description: Number of MongoDB replica set members/nodes to run. 1, 3, 5 or 7 node count is possible

replicaSetName.title: replication.replicaSetName
replicaSetName.description: Name of the MongoDB ReplicaSet. This cannot be changed after service start up, see the Limitations section of the documentation for more information

port.description: MongoDB server listening port. Must be a number between 1024 and 65535

storageEngine.title: storage.engine
storageEngine.description: Percona MongoDB storage engine (options: wiredTiger, mmapv1 or inMemory). This cannot be changed after service start up, see the Limitations section of the documentation for more information

placement.title: MongoDB Node Placement
placement.description: MongoDB Node Placement configuration properties. By default all data-bearing MongoDB tasks run on unique DC/OS agent hosts for high-availability

constraint.description: Marathon-style constraint for MongoDB server nodes (use empty string to override the default hostname UNIQUE behavior)

mongodb-credentials.title: MongoDB Credentials
mongodb-credentials.description: MongoDB System Users and Key configuration properties. Note: for security, system passwords must be 10-characters or longer. The 'key' should be generated using the command 'openssl rand -base64 756'.

backupPassword.description: MongoDB backup password, must be 10 characters or longer

userAdminPassword.description: MongoDB userAdmin password, must be 10 characters or longer

clusterAdminPassword.description: MongoDB clusterAdmin password, must be 10 characters or longer

clusterMonitorPassword.description: MongoDB clusterMonitor password, must be 10 characters or longer

key.description: The key to be used for intra-node replica set communication. The key must be 1024 characters long. We strongly recommend a new key is generated by running 'openssl rand -base64 756'

mongodb-advanced.description: MongoDB server advanced server configuration properties. Adjust with caution!

openFileLimit.title: Open Files Limit (ulimit)
openFileLimit.description: Maximum number of open files inside the container ('NOFILE' ulimit setting)

processLimit.title: Max Processes Limit (ulimit)
processLimit.description: Maximum number of processes running inside the container ('NPROC' ulimit setting)

redactClientLogData.title: security.redactClientLogData
redactClientLogData.description: The Percona Log Redaction feature prevents writing of potentially sensitive data stored on the database to the diagnostic log

indexBuildRetry.title: storage.indexBuildRetry
indexBuildRetry.description: Specifies whether mongod rebuilds incomplete indexes on the next start up

directoryPerDB.title: storage.directoryPerDB
directoryPerDB.description: When true, MongoDB uses a separate directory to store data for each database

syncPeriodSecs.title: storage.syncPeriodSecs
syncPeriodSecs.description: The amount of time that can pass before MongoDB flushes data to the data files via an fsync operation

enabled.title: storage.journal.enabled
enabled.description: Enable or disable the durability journal to ensure data files remain valid and recoverable

commitIntervalMs.title: storage.journal.commitIntervalMs
commitIntervalMs.description: The maximum amount of time in milliseconds that the mongod process allows between journal operations

preallocDataFiles.title: storage.mmapv1.preallocDataFiles
preallocDataFiles.description: Enables or disables the preallocation of data files. By default, MongoDB does not preallocate data files

nsSize.title: storage.mmapv1.nsSize
nsSize.description: The default size for namespace files, which are files that end in .ns. Each collection and index counts as a namespace

quotaEnforced.title: storage.mmapv1.quota.enforced
quotaEnforced.description: Enable or disable the enforcement of a maximum limit for the number data files each database can have

quotaMaxFilesPerDB.title: storage.mmapv1.quota.maxFilesPerDB
quotaMaxFilesPerDB.description: The limit on the number of data files per database

smallFiles.title: storage.mmapv1.smallFiles
smallFiles.description: When true, MongoDB uses a smaller default file size

engineConfigCacheSizeRatio.title: storage.wiredTiger.engineConfig.cacheSizeGB ratio
engineConfigCacheSizeRatio.description: The ratio of available memory to be used for the WiredTiger cache. For optimal performance we recommend this value is 0.5 (50%) or less

engineConfigJournalCompressor.title: storage.wiredTiger.engineConfig.journalCompressor
engineConfigJournalCompressor.description: The type of compression to use to compress WiredTiger journal data. Available compressors are: none, snappy, zlib

engineConfigDirectoryForIndexes.title: storage.wiredTiger.engineConfig.directoryForIndexes
engineConfigDirectoryForIndexes.description: When true, mongod stores indexes and collections in separate subdirectories under the data (i.e. storage.dbPath) directory

collectionConfigBlockCompressor.title: storage.wiredTiger.collectionConfig.blockCompressor
collectionConfigBlockCompressor.description: The default type of compression to use to compress collection data. You can override this on a per-collection basis when creating collections. Available compressors are: none, snappy, zlib

indexConfigPrefixCompression.title: storage.wiredTiger.indexConfig.prefixCompression
indexConfigPrefixCompression.description: Specify true to enable prefix compression for index data, or false to disable prefix compression for index data

failIndexKeyTooLong.title: setParameter: failIndexKeyTooLong
failIndexKeyTooLong.description: Enable failing of updates and inserts that have indexed values longer than the Index Key Length Limit

maxIndexBuildMemoryUsageMB.title: setParameter: maxIndexBuildMemoryUsageMB
maxIndexBuildMemoryUsageMB.description: Limits the amount of memory that simultaneous foreground index builds on one collection may consume for the duration of the builds

logUserIds.title: setParameter: logUserIds
logUserIds.description: Enable logging of user IDs. 1 = true, 0 = false

ttlMonitorEnabled.title: setParameter: ttlMonitorEnabled
ttlMonitorEnabled.description: Enable background thread that is responsible for deleting documents from collections with TTL indexes

ttlMonitorSleepSecs.title: setParameter: ttlMonitorSleepSecs
ttlMonitorSleepSecs.description: Defines the number of seconds to wait between checking TTL Indexes for old documents and removing them

wiredTigerConcurrentReadTransactions.title: setParameter: wiredTigerConcurrentReadTransactions
wiredTigerConcurrentReadTransactions.description: Maximum number of concurrently running read transactions in the WiredTiger engine

wiredTigerConcurrentWriteTransactions.title: setParameter: wiredTigerConcurrentWriteTransactions
wiredTigerConcurrentWriteTransactions.description: Maximum number of concurrently running write transactions in the WiredTiger engine

maxIncomingConnections.title: net.maxIncomingConnections
maxIncomingConnections.description: Specify the maximum number of incoming connections

transportLayer.title: net.transportLayer
transportLayer.description: The networking implementation the mongos or mongod uses. To revert to the pre-version 3.6 implementation, change this option to 'legacy'

serviceExecutor.title: net.serviceExecutor
serviceExecutor.description: Determines the threading and execution model mongos or mongod uses to execute client requests.

mode.title: operationProfiling.mode
mode.description: Percona MongoDB operation profiling mode (options: slowOp, all or off)

slowOpThresholdMs.title: operationProfiling.slowOpThresholdMs
slowOpThresholdMs.description: Percona MongoDB operation profiling slowOp mode threshold in milliseconds

rateLimit.title: operationProfiling.rateLimit
rateLimit.description: Percona MongoDB operation profiling rate limiting value

secondaryIndexPrefetch.title: replication.secondaryIndexPrefetch
secondaryIndexPrefetch.description: The indexes that secondary members of a replica set load into memory before applying operations from the oplog

auditLog.title: Percona AuditLog
auditLog.description: Percona Server for MongoDB AuditLog configuration properties. The audit log is written to the file 'auditLog.bson' in the MongoDB data path

enabled.title: Enable PSMDB Audit Log
enabled.description: Enables the Percona Server for MongoDB audit log feature

filter.title: auditLog.filter
filter.description: The filter document (in json style) to be used for filtering the Percona Server for MongoDB audit log

auditAuthorizationSuccess.title: setParameter: auditAuthorizationSuccess
auditAuthorizationSuccess.description: Enables the logging of all read and write operations

verbosity.title: systemLog.verbosity
verbosity.description: The default log message verbosity level for components. The verbosity level determines the amount of Informational and Debug messages MongoDB outputs. The verbosity level can range from 0 to 5

traceAllExceptions.title: systemLog.traceAllExceptions
traceAllExceptions.description: Print verbose information for debugging. Use for additional logging for support-related troubleshooting

timestampFormat.title: systemLog.timestampFormat
timestampFormat.description: The time format for timestamps in log messages. Specify one of the following values: ctime, iso8601-utc, iso8601-local

mongodb-ssl.title: MongoDB SSL
mongodb-ssl.description: MongoDB SSL configuration properties. This section requires DC/OS Enterprise Edition!

enabled.title: Enable MongoDB SSL Support
enabled.description: Enables SSL support for Percona Server for MongoDB server

mode.title: MongoDB SSL Mode
mode.description: MongoDB SSL mode. See documentation for net.ssl.mode for more information

name.title: DC/OS SSL Name
name.description: Name of the SSL certificates that are auto-generated by DC/OS. Leave empty to auto-generate as 'SERVICENAME-REPLSETNAME'

allowConnectionsWithoutCertificates.title: net.ssl.allowConnectionsWithoutCertificates
allowConnectionsWithoutCertificates.description: Allow MongoDB to accept connections when the client does not present a certificate when establishing the connection

allowInvalidCertificates.title: net.ssl.allowInvalidCertificates
allowInvalidCertificates.description: Disable the validation checks for TLS/SSL certificates on other servers in the cluster and allow invalid certificates

allowInvalidHostnames.title: net.ssl.allowInvalidHostnames
allowInvalidHostnames.description: Disable the validation of the hostnames in TLS/SSL certificates, allowing mongod to connect to MongoDB instances if the hostname their certificates do not match the specified hostname

disabledProtocols.title: net.ssl.disabledProtocols
disabledProtocols.description: Prevents server from accepting incoming connections that use a specific protocol or protocols. net.ssl.disabledProtocols recognizes the following protocols: TLS1_0, TLS1_1, and TLS1_2. Specifying an unrecognized protocol will prevent the server from starting. To specify multiple protocols, use a comma separated list of protocols

backup-restore.description: Backup and Restore configuration properties. Only mongodump-based backup and AWS S3 (for backup storage) is supported currently

cpus.title: Backup/restore node cpus
cpus.description: Node cpu requirements for backup and restore process

mem.title: Backup/restore node mem
mem.description: Node mem requirements for backup and restore process, in megabytes

s3.title: AWS S3 configuration
s3.description: Backup and Restore Amazon Web Services S3 configuration properties

region.title: region
region.description: Backup and restore s3 region for upload

accessKey.title: access_key
accessKey.description: Backup and restore s3 access key

secretKey.title: secret_key
secretKey.description: Backup and restore s3 secret key

s3Url.description: AWS S3 URL to mongodump backup directory in 's3://<bucket-name>/<path>/' format. A URL for the backup is required for restore!

restoreAfterInit.description: Restore replica set from backup after initiation

gzip.description: Enable gzip on restore. Backup data must be gzip compressed

dropCollections.description: Drop collections during restore. This is usually required to avoid duplicate key errors on restore

oplogReplay.description: Replay the backup oplog after restoring the collections, strongly recommended!

numParallelCollections.description: Number of collections to restore in parallel

s3bucketPrefix.title: bucket_prefix
s3bucketPrefix.description: Backup upload s3 bucket key prefix

s3chunkSizeMb.title: chunk_size_mb
s3chunkSizeMb.description: Backup and restore s3 chunk size in megabytes

hiddenSecondary.title: Backup Hidden Secondary Node
hiddenSecondary.description: MongoDB Hidden-secondary backup node configuration properties. A Hidden-secondary node is recommended for low impact backups as it does not receive application traffic and cannot win a failover-election

enabled.title: Add dedicated MongoDB backup node
enabled.description: Add a hidden-secondary MongoDB node dedicated to backup operations. This node cannot become primary and is invible to MongoDB drivers. The node will inherit any config options passed to the other mongod nodes

cpus.title: Dedicated MongoDB backup node cpus
cpus.description: MongoDB backup hidden-secondary node cpu requirements

mem.title: Dedicated MongoDB backup node mem
mem.description: MongoDB backup hidden-secondary node mem requirements, in megabytes

enabled.title: Enable DC/OS Metrics
enabled.description: Enable the sending of MongoDB metrics to DC/OS Metrics

intervalSecs.title: Metrics Collect Interval
intervalSecs.description: The frequency to collect MongoDB metrics, in seconds

mem.description: Admin node mem requirements. Must be 64 or greater

init.description: Init task configuration properties. This task runs once on initiation of a new MongoDB Replica Set

initiateDelay.description: The delay before starting the ReplicaSet initialization, must end in 's' for seconds, 'm' for minutes, etc

maxConnectTries.description: The number of times to try to connect to a database host

maxInitReplsetTries.description: The number of times to try to initiate the replica set

maxAddUsersTries.description: The number of times to try to add database users

retrySleep.description: The duration to wait between retries

watchdog.description: Watchdog daemon configuration properties. This daemon watches the DC/OS API for changes and updates the MongoDB Replica Set

apiPoll.description: DCOS API poll frequency, must end in 's' for seconds, 'm' for minutes, etc

apiTimeout.description: Pod API timeout than apiPoll frequency, must end in 's' for seconds, 'm' for minutes, etc

replsetPoll.description: MongoDB replica set state poll frequency, must end in 's' for seconds, 'm' for minutes, etc

replsetTimeout.description: MongoDB replica set timeout, should be less than replsetPoll frequency, must end in 's' for seconds, 'm' for minutes, etc

metricsPort.description: Prometheus Metrics server port, default '0' uses a random available port
